culturalContext.description: Opening action: cleaning a type of fish
facts: Cá Mè is mud carp, common freshwater fish in Vietnam
Xỉa means to clean/scrape fish scales

culturalContext.description: Second action with different fish type
facts: Cá Chép is common carp, prestigious fish
Đè suggests holding fish firmly while cleaning

phrases.text: Chân nào đẹp đi buôn men
phrases.english: Whoever has beautiful legs goes to trade fermented rice

culturalContext.description: Conditional statement about beauty and trading
facts: Men is fermented rice used for rice wine
Beautiful legs suggest ability to travel/trade

phrases.text: Chân nào đen về làm chó làm mèo
phrases.english: Whoever has dark legs stays home to be a dog or cat

culturalContext.description: Contrasting fate: dark legs means staying home doing menial work
facts: Dark skin associated with outdoor labor, lower status
Chó mèo (dog cat) suggests lowly domestic work

patterns.dominantTheme: Folk song contrasting beauty standards and social roles through fish cleaning and trading imagery
